note: Like a Michelangelo; everything is in perfect proportion. Has an amazing amount of violets, new wood and fruit on the nose and palate and a superb concentration of silky tannins. The wine of the vintage, and the best from this estate since the legendary 1961. Best after 2000.

Complex and fascinating, offering all sorts of floral, earthy overtones to the solid core of black cherry, blackberry and anise flavors. An intense wine that shows many facets, including a welcome whiff of vanilla and toast on the aftertaste. 2,700 cases made.

wine_full: Cabernet Sauvignon Napa Valley Limited Reserve
note: A beautifully crafted Cabernet that combines ripe, rich, complex currant, black cherry, cedar, vanilla bean and spice. Wonderful depth, beautifully articulated flavors that keep pumping out the flavors. Delicious now, but should hold and gain through the decade. Best after 1996. 2,994 cases made.
Seductively powerful, with tons of lovely oak and ripe fruit flavors, full tannins and a long, luscious finish. Drinkable in 1998. 20,000 cases made.
A throughbred of a wine that takes off on the finish. Superb. Wonderful aromas and flavors of coconut, lemon and pineapple. Full bodied yet balanced. Drink after 1997. 3,000 cases made.

This seductive, exciting Bordeaux has pulled all together since our barrel tasting. Harmonious and silky in texture, with mint, berry and cassis aromas and flavors and ultrafine tannins. It's hard not to drink it now, but try to wait. Best after 1998. 33,500 cases made.

Opulent and chewy with lots of ripe fruit flavors and spicy, buttery oak shadings. Serves up a rich core of black cherry, currant and plum-tinged fruit and finishes with a delicious encore of fruit and oak. Wonderful depth, richness, balance and finesse. 2,400 cases made.

This is a blockbuster with masses of chocolate, earth, minty aromas and flavors; full bodied with full round tannins and a super acid backbone. Best Ornellaia ever made. Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. 8,330 cases made.

Sculpted like a Rodin, this is a rugged yet well-defined Bordeaux that offers one of the best values of this outstanding vintage. Shows concentrated cassis, berry and dark chocolate flavors, rich tannins and a long, opulent finish. Best after 1998. 20,000 cases made.

The great first-growth estate produced a wine with amazing length in this new vintage. Goes on and on, with mint, plum and cassis aromas and flavors and ultrafine tannins. A superb Bordeaux. Best after 1999. 25,000 cases made.

Tough in texture, but ripe and toasty, offering lovely black cherry, plum and violet aromas and flavors, remaining generous and flavorful through the firm and elegant finish. Needs time to sort out the tannins, but everything is beautifully integrated and harmonious. Best after 1997. 900 cases made.

An absolutely massive Bordeaux, with tons of exotic, ripe raspberry flavor and velvety tannins. Thick and rich, yet has great balance. A fine candidate for cellaring. Best after 2000. 2,000 cases made.

Smooth, rich and opulent, exotically spicy, deep and concentrated. Lays out plum, prune, nutmeg, cedar and black cherry flavors with almost digital definition, echoing licorice on the finish. Fabulous, supple and delicious now. Best from 1995 through 2002. 915 cases made.

Ripe and chunky, a demonically concentrated wine, its cherry, mineral, toast and violet flavors richeting around the palate, an exuberant, profound wine that needs until 1997 or 1998 just to settle down; should be at its best after 2000. 700 cases made.

An aristocratic wine that's almost as good as the awesome '89. Expressive and sophisticated, with wonderful ripe fruit and vanilla aromas, a palate of extremely silky tannins and superb flavor concentration. Best after 1999. 3,700 cases made.
The Charles Atlas of Pomerol, with great muscular tannins. Amazingly ripe, offering intense oak, chocolate and fruit aromas and flavors. Best after 1998. 2,300 cases made.

This stunning wine is rippling with layers and layers of dense, exuberant black cherry, violet, blackberry, tar and vanilla aromas and flavors. Muscular at the core, but sweet and supple through the extraordinary finish. A great wine in any context. The tannins are so refined you could drink it now, but has the stuff to age past 2000. 825 cases made.

wine_full: Johannisberg Riesling Alexander Valley Late Harvest Special Select
note: Deep, dark, ripe and rich, a gorgeous, unctuous wine that offers cascades of honey, floral, caramel, apricot, pear and ginger aromas and flavors, finishing almost delicate for such a rich wine. Fabulous to drink now, perhaps best in 1996-1998. 475 cases made.

This big, up-front Bordeaux offers intense cedar, tobacco, cassis and berry aromas that carry through on the palate and lots of tannins to back it all up. As big as the great '82. Best after 1998. 27,500 cases made.

Combines power and elegance, showing the rich structure of a long-aging wine, yet the complexity is already elegant, with ripe fruit, cedar, licorice, violet, plum and mineral aromas and flavors. Best after 2000. 8,500 cases made.

Dense and powerful, with a breathtaking aftertaste of blackberries, chocolate and earth flavors. A superb wine; the harmonious structure will easily take it into the next century. Best after 2000. 2,600 cases made.
A deep, dark giant, with smoky cassis aromas and flavors and tons of fruit and tannins. Isn't giving much now, but it's all there. Best after 2000. 900 cases made.

A luscious mouthful of wild berries, black cherry, toast and rose petal. Concentrated and exotic, a powerful wine with totally disarming aromas and flavors and remarkably supple texture. Layers and layers of personality make this a stellar candidate for cellaring. Best after 1997. 800 cases made.

A mind-bending wine—deep, dark, dense and concentrated. A powerful wine with generous raspberry and cherry flavors, ample tannins that is smoothly integrated. Gorgeous rose- and tar-scented flavors carry through the finish. 680 cases made.
Dances across your palate with floral, vanilla, blackberry and black cherry flavors and superbly silky tannins. An exciting wine. Drink after 1998. 8,000 cases made.
A textbook wine for the appellation, with spicy, meaty characteristics, full tannins and a long, juicy finish. Don't touch this for a decade. Drink after 2000. 10,000 cases made.
Solid and racy, with complex tar, licorice, violet and ripe fruit aromas that echo in the flavors. Shows excellent tannin structure. Drink after 1998. 5,000 cases made.

As usual, this is big, thick and rich, showing loads of nutmeg, berry and ripe fruit characteristics. Long on the finish, with extremely velvety tannins. Has put on weight since our first barrel tasting. Drink after 1998. 6,000 cases made.

The greatest Sangioveto ever made. Massive wine with layers of tobacco, chocolate and violet character; full bodied and complete with perfect tannin structure and excellent acid. Best after 1997. 500 cases made.

A seamless wine with great character, offering cigar, tobacco, cedar, and rich plum flavors. Full-bodied yet well balanced, with lovely, full, silky tannins and a long finish. Best after 2000. 13,000 cases made.

Sensational expression of Nebbiolo, exploding with black cherry, wild berry, lemon verbena and anise flavors without an overlay of oak, an exotic wine that holds itself in check just enough to qualify as elegant. Fresh and vibrant, tempting to drink now, but probably best from 1996. 600 cases made.

Totally disarming, a gorgeous array of rose petal and anise-scented raspberry, vanilla and strawberry aromas and flavors extending through a supple finish that wraps its fine tannins smoothly around the warm fruit and spice. Drink now. 725 cases made.
Wild and exciting, a classy wine with a round, polished texture and intense smoke, vanilla and grape aromas and flavors. This property is really coming on strong. Best after 1997. 3,000 cases made.
Packed to the brim with coconut, butterscotch, apple and pineapple character. Full-bodied, with amazing acidity and class.  Try now. 600 cases made.
Fantastic, with intense aromas of white truffles, apples and fruit. Full-bodied and concentrated, with great acidity. Drink now. 300 cases made.
A wine with laser-guided flavors. Intense pear, lemon, vanilla and coconut character. Great backbone and superb, fresh finish. Best after 1996. 700 cases made.
Overflowing with berry and raspberry flavors, this is elegant and fine in structure, with firm tannins and excellent length. Drink after 1998. 14,500 cases made.

Young, firm and intense, with a rich, complex, concentrated core of currant, cherry, anise and toasty, buttery oak flavors. A wine of great harmony, finesse, elegance and grace. Well-articulated fruit flavors stay focused on the long, rich finish. Delicious now, with its silky tannins, but should age well through the decade. Perhaps best around 1997. 3,646 cases made.

This monstrous wine shows huge amounts of cherry and toasted oak flavors and velvety tannins. Quite hard on the palate, but the very long finish suggests greatness. From Jean-Michel Cazes. Drink after 1998. 12,500 cases made.
A superbly crafted wine, with lush, velvety tannins and gorgeous plum, earth and vanilla flavors. This estate is on the rise. Try in 1998. 13,000 cases made.
Big and chunky, offering loads of strawberry, earth, toasted oak and mint aromas and flavors. Has superb, velvety tannins and a long finish. Drink after 1997. 4,500 cases made.

Ripe, round and utterly distinctive, a rich-textured, refined wine with layers of spice, black cherry, black raspberry and cola winding through very fine, smooth-textured tannins, echoing coffee and violets along with the fruit. So supple that it's drinkable now, but best after 1996. 3,000 cases made.

Smooth, ripe and exotic. This fat, opulent wine displays spectacular blackberry, black cherry, currant and plum aromas and flavors that all come together in a silky, supple package. Delicious now, but should keep growing through 1998. 531 cases made.

Wonderful richness, depth and complexity, jam-packed with flavor, with tiers of pear, spice, apple and pineapple framed by smoky, toasty oak nuances that fold together into a tight, youthful and vibrant wine. Delicious now, but a good bet to gain through 1996. 400 cases made.

Ripe, intense and concentrated, with rich, spicy pear, peach and pineapple flavors that are smooth and polished. Reveals more depth and finesse with each sip and gains complexity and grace on the long, smoky finish. Simply delicious to drink now. 6,000 cases made.

Powerful and exotic, displaying full-blown tropical fruit flavors and a spicy character. This full-bodied wine towers over most others in this category with its sheer intensity. Drinkable now. 200 cases made.

Deep, dense and delicious, bursting with plum, currant, chocolate and spice aromas and flavors, generous and concentrated, an elegant wine with power. Echoes anise and fruit on the long finish. Has enough tannin to want until 1998-2000. 2,000 cases made.
Sleek and racy, with plum, raspberry and earth aromas and flavors, silky tannins and a wonderfully long finish. Drink after 1998. 22,000 cases made.
Like eating a reduced raspberry sauce. Rich and thick, with tons of fruit and velvety tannins, yet it's perfectly balanced. Drink now through 2003. 25,000 cases made.
Like a wild horse. Tons of potential. It's extremely exuberant and lively. Full bodied with masses of lemon, toast and apple character. It shows great acidity and long finish.

A stunning wine. Wonderfully deep, rich and complex, with tiers of honey, pear, spice and pineapple flavors, a silky-smooth texture and a finish that keeps pumping out the flavors. A wine with presence. Ready now through 1996. Definitely improved since o 750 cases made.

Smooth, polished and velvety, a richly layered wine with marvelous plum, blackberry, vanilla, toast and spice aromas and flavors that linger on the finish. Graceful and deep. Perhaps best around 2000 to 2005. 1,446 cases made.

Packs in lots of flavor, with ripe, spicy honey, pear, citrus and buttery oak nuances that turn rich and smooth on the palate. Has depth and complexity, echoing honey and spice on the long finish. Delicious now. 11,759 cases made.

wine_full: Muscat Canelli Monterey Vin de Glacière
note: Brilliantly spicy, fruity and generous, showing its flavors with digital clarity—nutmeg, cinnamon, pear, apple and honey—finishing sweet, rich and amazingly balanced. Drinkable now. 3,200 cases made.
Deep, dense, dark and powerful, with layers and layers of plum, berry, chocolate, coffee and cedar flavors finishing round and generous. Drink now. 1,900 cases made.

This electrifying wine jolts you with its intense flavors. Starts with citrus, apricot and lemon notes and ends with honey, floral and almond flavors on the clean, focused, complex finish. Drinkable now, but should be better after 1997. 350 cases made.

This delicious wine pumps out lots of flavor, with pear, spice, vanilla, apple and peach all rolling together in the same direction. Elegant, impeccably balanced and long and lingering on the finish, where it turns to honey and sweet oak. Drink now. 15,000 cases made.
A gorgeous wine that keeps you coming back for more, offering wonderful milk chocolate, roasted oak and fruit aromas and flavors and plenty of silky tannins. Best after 1997. 3,500 cases made.
Rich and earthy with complex pear, toast and honeyed flavors that taste mature, picking up carmel and earth flavors that offer uncommon depth and richness. Delicious now. 2,000 cases made.

wine_full: Meursault Les Tessons Clos de Mon Plaisir
note: A blockbuster, with vanilla, honey, butterscotch and ripe fruit aromas and flavors. Full-bodied and immensely appealing. Best after 1996. 475 cases made.
Peppery, spicy notes invigorate this smooth-textured, nicely balanced wine, berry at the core, hinting at tobacco and tar on the rich finish. Drinkable now through 1996 and beyond. 11,000 cases made.

This Washington wine has all the facets and depth you want in a barrel-fermented, malolactic-style Chardonnay.  Apple and pear flavors are spiced up by toasty, buttery aromas and a spicy, butterscotchy note on the finish.  Rich, beautifully balanced and complex. 7,500 cases made.

Delicious, pure and ripe, offering cherry, raspberry, plum and spice flavors. Intense, complex, wonderfully balanced and harmonious. Try a bottle now and enjoy for its vitality, and keep a few to see what happens. Best from 1994 through 2000. 531 cases made.

Ripe, lush and spicy, with a rich core of pear, peach and nectarine flavors kept alive by crisp acidity. Has a smooth, creamy texture and a long, full, lingering aftertaste. Drink now. 3,470 cases made.

Comes alive with rich, complex fruit that echoes currant, spice and cherry, with a pretty toasty, buttery character from new oak. Balanced and concentrated, adding a long, full finish that keeps pumping out the flavor. 66 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 18 percent Cabernet Franc, 15 percent Merlot. 4,672 cases made.

Bold, ripe, rich and creamy with pretty spice and vanilla flavors, but also a load of pear, apple, citrus and toast notes on a long, full, complex finish. Wonderful sense of harmony and finesse; drinks well now but should hold through 1995. 3,400 cases made.

Youthful, tight and focused, with spicy pear, nutmeg and melon flavors and pretty oak shadings. An impeccably well-balanced wine that allows the ripe fruit to play off the toasty oak and stay together through the finish. Drinkable now, but may benefit from cellaring. 6,000 cases made.

Ripe, rich and packed with flavor, with tiers of honey, pear and butterscotch. The texture is smooth and silky, and flavors run on and on, gaining nuances on the finish. Best Rombauer Chardonnay in years. Delicious now through 1995. 4,000 cases made.

Ripe, rich and seductive with currant, black cherry, anise and plum flavors framed by toasty, buttery oak notes. Uncommon in California Merlot for its opulence and finesse; has fine tannins and a silky texture, yet also the depth to age through 1997. 15,000 cases made.

Ripe, round and spicy, this uniquely balanced wine offers hazelnut, butter and toast nuances to the basic green apple and honeydew melon aromas and flavors that echo on the long finish. A stylish wine that shows all the signs of growing more complex. Drink now through 1995. 20,000 cases made.

A great combination of ripeness and delicacy, with honey, hazelnut, pear and butter flavors. True Chardonnay flavor comes through in this Washington wine, with complexity and length. Beautifully balanced, showing richness without weight. Drink now through 1995. 2,060 cases made.

wine_full: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Lytton Springs
note: Full-blown and fully oaked, displaying a fine, deep color, rich fruit flavors and polished tannins. Lush in texture and sweet with vanilla and spice notes from oak aging, but backed by solid blackberry, currant and black cherry flavors. A concentrated California Zinfandel. Best from 1995 through 2000. 7,430 cases made.
A classy wine that shows great winemaking. Fills your mouth with plum and black cherry flavors and silky tannins. From Michel Rolland. Drinkable now. 3,500 cases made.

A tight, tannic wine, with potential for aging. Already has a complex aroma, but the stiff texture and intense fruit will need time to open up for maximum enjoyment. Currant, black cherry, cedar, earth and spice flavors make it fascinating to sip. Best after 1997. 6,000 cases made.

Firm and intense with a solid core of cherry, currant, plum and spice flavors that gently unfold into a spicy, concentrated, impeccably balanced wine that finishes with pretty, cedary oak notes and fine tannins. Tempting now for its plush texture, but sure to pick up complexity. Drink now through 2002. 2,400 cases made.

Sleek and flavorful, this pretty, almost exotic wine has lots of fruit and spice flavors and a long finish. Mint and currant aromas, a smooth texture, supple tannins and great balance add to its appeal. Drinkable now, but so nicely proportioned that it should age through at least 1997. 10,000 cases made.

Ripe, smooth and polished, with rich, concentrated pear, fig, herb, spice and citrus flavors that turn creamy and complex on the long, full finish. One sip calls for another. Delicious through 1995. 11,500 cases made.

Firm and flavorful, with a nice array of spicy, toasty, slightly herbal pear, honey and grapefruit aromas and flavors that ride gently into a long finish. Stylish, harmonious and graceful, showing a definite touch of oak. Drinkable now. 2,803 cases made.

A full-fledged Merlot, with ripe, spicy flavors, a deep color and a lingering finish. Packs in currant, plum and black cherry flavors accented by cedar, nutmeg and vanilla from oak aging, all wrapped in a supple but firm texture and fine tannins. Shows great potential. Drink from 1994 to 2000. 1,800 cases made.

wine_full: Zinfandel Dry Creek Valley Gold Leaf Cuvée
note: Crisp and lively, with a rich, focused band of raspberry, cherry and currant flavors flanked by firm, drying tannins. Packs in lots of fresh, lively fruit and is elegantly balanced. The tannins suggest you can cellar this through 1998. 2,050 cases made.

Solidly built, well packed with currant, plum, toast and tobacco aromas and flavors, persisting and spreading on the finish. Gets a little tannic, but it should be terrific after 1998. 33,381 cases made.

This has what many '92 Mosel Rieslings are lacking: structure and concentration. A bit shy now, but the peach, floral and mineral flavors become fuller and more complex after a while in the glass. Try now.

wine_full: Meursault Clos de la Baronne Domaine René Manuel
note: Wonderfully ripe, with toasted oak, vanilla, honey and tropical fruit; a full body and a long, flavorful, fresh finish. Drink now. 800 cases made.
Lovely, with lime, lemon, mineral and vanilla aromas and flavors, medium body and an intense finish. Drink now.

Ripe and complex, a full-bodied wine with more finesse than most, offering harmonious black cherry, plum, anise and tar, along with a definite toasty spiciness. Tannins are definitely firm, but there is a real sense of freshness that should keep it developing through 1998. 7,000 cases made.

Smooth and polished, with an elegant beam of raspberry, cherry, spice and rose petal lighting up the aromas and flavors, sweet tannins swarming over the finish. Still, the fruit shines through. Best to drink from 1997. 1,800 cases made.

wine_full: Chardonnay Santa Ynez Valley Barrel Fermented
note: A graceful, harmonious California Chardonnay, with plenty of style. Crisp, focused and flavorful, with spicy, toasty apple, pear and vanilla aromas and flavors that swirl around on the finish. Drinkable now. 16,000 cases made.

Firm and ripe, a medium-weight wine with a fleshy texture and spicy, cedary currant and mineral aromas and flavors, all of it smoothly shaped into a wine that should continue to improve through 1999. 35,000 cases made.

Ripe and distinctive, with a toffee, spice-scented tone to the supple currant and blackberry flavors, finishing rich and elegant. Has the style and concentration to mature through 1998. 70 percent Cabernet Sauvignon, 25 percent Cabernet Franc and 5 percent Merlot. 8,000 cases made.
Exceedingly ripe with wild fruit and earthy aromas and flavors; full bodied and intense with firm acidity. Drink now. 5,000 cases made.

A youthful, intense Hermitage that shows a lot of spicy oak at this stage, but concentrated black cherry and currant flavors underneath mark it as a serious candidate for the cellar. It's rare to find this much flavor, but the tannins and obvious oak not 4,000 cases made.

Ripe, smooth and complex, offering silky, elegant cola, cherry, currant and vanilla flavors that are rich and intense, with subtle nuances and deep, lingering flavors. Drinks well now, but appears to have the intensity and depth to cellar through 1996. T 640 cases made.

Ripe, rich and concentrated, yet it remains extraordinarily well balanced, harmonious and elegant. Starts off with plum, currant and black cherry flavors, then offers shades of hazelnut, vanilla and spice nuances, finishing with a velvety aftertaste. Drink now through 1999. 1,015 cases made.

Gallo hits the big time with this outstanding new estate Chardonnay. Elegant, rich and flavorful, with beautiful detail. Has wonderful balance and finesse. Picks up a smoky edge on the finish. Drink now through 1995. 3,520 cases made.

Packs in lots of concentrated flavors, yet maintains its elegance and finesse, with spicy pear, vanilla, toast and light cherry notes, finishing with a smooth, creamy texture. Drink now through 1996. 4,000 cases made.

A wonderful example of just how good California bubbly can be. Creamy and rich, a toasty wine with pear and hazelnut notes that keep singing on the finish. A graceful bubbly with style and plenty of flavor, a lot like a fine Champagne. 4,600 cases made.

Not as appealing as the '89, our Wine of the Year in 1991, but it's a generous, concentrated, intensely fruity Châteauneuf that blends mouthfilling flavors with complex cedar, spice and leather accents. Sturdy tannins and solid acidity mark this as a good candidate to cellar. Best after 1996. 17,000 cases made.
Incredibly fresh and vivid with berry, floral aromas and flavors, full bodied and full tannins yet very silky. Drinkable now. 1,200 cases made.

A solid wine with beautifully articulated currant, spice and vanilla aromas and flavors, smooth and generous on the long finish. Has style and grace to age through at least 1998. A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Sangiovese, Merlot and Cabernet Franc. 375 cases made.

Smooth, ripe and focused, with supple cherry, plum and cedary oak flavors that run deep and gain complexity on the finish. Drinks well now, but has elegance, balance and fine tannins to age. Drink now through 1997. 2,350 cases made.
